alert.note: Alert for Clark; Clay; Crawford; Cumberland; Effingham; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 17 at 2:09PM CST until February 17 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central Illinois and southeast Illinois, including the following counties, in east central Illinois, Clark and Cumberland. In southeast Illinois, Clay, Crawford, Effingham, Jasper, Lawrence and Richland. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional rain and freezing rain will exacerbate already saturated soils. Enhanced runoff will allow for creeks and rivers to rise sharply. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Clark; Clay; Crawford; Cumberland; Effingham; Jasper; Lawrence; Richland
